title: Pure shape dynamics, self-subsisting structures, and the nature of time
abstract:
The paper discusses the possible implications of the relational framework of
Pure Shape Dynamics for the metaphysics of time. The starting point of the
analysis is an interpretation of shapes in ontic structural realist terms,
which gives rise to the notion of self-subsisting structure. The relational
version of a Newtonian-particle toy model is introduced and discussed as a
concrete example.
